CatDescriptText: Charlotte Kolb, secretary, Mt. Lebanon, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 17, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe that city patrolmen and firemen should be required to work more than 40 hours per week?" answer reads: "No. I have friends who are policemen and I believe that they should work and be paid like others.  If they do work overtime, they should be paid.  They do as good a job as other workers.  In fact, they do better jobs than many office workers."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charlotte Kolb wearing sunglasses and light colored leather jacket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
